subject: literacy
learning_outcomes: Recognise and name all letters of the English alphabet (upper and lower case)
Produce and identify basic letter sounds (phonemes)
Listen to and respond to simple spoken instructions and short stories
Speak in short phrases about familiar topics (self, family, classroom)
Read and decode simple CVC (consonant-vowel-consonant) words and common sight words
Write letters legibly and form simple words and their name
Demonstrate early comprehension by retelling simple stories and answering who/what questions
Use rhymes, songs and games to develop phonological awareness
topics: Phonics: initial, medial, final sounds; CVC words
Listening and oral language: following instructions, retelling
Speaking: greetings, introductions, short oral responses
Emergent reading: high-frequency/sight words, picture-based reading
Emergent writing: name writing, simple words, left-to-right writing
Oral storytelling, rhymes and songs to build vocabulary
